tags: you might have or maybe you didnt notice that ive been doing more cr1 art than 2 after molly died
and its true ive been working on a lot of vm stuff bc i got hit with inspiration but that inspiration didnt hit until after a down period
after molly died i spent a long time feeling very depressed by what had happened
it honestly made me consider stopping watching the show and i did for a week. to this day i still havent seen his funeral bc them just
but i know i can draw him without it being sad again
Mollymauk meant so much to me and had become so dear and he still does

summary: [AO3] Witness All Your Joy (Prompt: Moonweaver)
title: [AO3] Witness All Your Joy (Prompt: Moonweaver)
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Rating: G
Warnings: None
Characters: Mollymauk Tealeaf, the Moonweaver, Jester, rest of the Nein in background

Summary: Molly’s been back for a while now, and he’s still not sure what he owes his goddess for the second chance. When he finds an actual temple to her while traveling with his friends, he takes the chance to ask.

(Set several months post-resurrection.)

blog.name: theculturedyeti
blog.title: The Cultured Yeti
blog.description:
Campfire whispers. Rustling pages.
Stories come to life.

summary: Friends of the Mighty Nein
title: Friends of the Mighty Nein
body:
Lumbering, meaty hands give way to intricate enchantment. Looming, mighty frame encloses a caring heart. Once to stand alone, vagrant to affection, but now imbued with possibility, companionship makes invulnerable. His name is Pumat Sol and he is also Pumat Sol and he, himself, is also Pumat Sol. (The fourth one’s in the back)

His arrival announced by the whistling pierce of a Grand Duchess darting from pillar to post, a blur of fluttering winds and sharpened beak to reveal a shock of strikingly white hair. Eyes haunted ivory by tempestuous crescendo and a voice that’s smooth in charm, fierce in warnings and thunderous in polemics. His name is Shakäste and he is a preacher man.

Pale white flesh glimmering in the moonlit swamp water and interlocking scales caught in the glow of amber. A pale white hand that wishes to reach out and a twisted black claw that knows it never can. And from the fusion of woman and dragon emerges a spark, not of fire… but of hope. Her name is Caliana and she wants to leave the past behind.

A riffle of black feathers to reveal wide, excited eyes. The faint melody of a music box, wafting through the air. As sharp as a knife in a dead man’s side, as mischievous and virulent as the words in her companion’s mouthes. Freed from the chains of a swampland, now those black feathers can spread wide. Her name is Kiri and yes, she’s very sweet.

Bristles shadow the sides of her face, whilst battered armour hangs from her frame. But take those away and hang the broken reading glasses on her nose, light her a cigarette and ask about the old days when bells rung for an hour and the shepherds weren’t so iron… Her name is Keg and she’s trying to make amends.

A whiff of oak and soil, caught in the glitter of golden sunlight above. A scent of baby powder, resting against blankets and mingling with the fresh drop of a tear. The mingling aromas of galloping horses and scuttling mice and they’re all firmly you. A deep inhale, bringing with it all those wonderful smells. A deep inhale, bringing with it reassurance and courage. Her name is Nila and she is ready to face the world.
